channel.title: YOUR favorite Borderlands? Help me out people
channel.description:
For those who have played and experienced Borderlands.. What was your favorite out of the 3? I've played Borderlands 1 (original) only, but I recently got the Pre-Sequel for Christmas and my friend has the second one.
So I'm half way finished with Borderlands one... and I've gotten to play the others. My question to you folks, is what game is your favorite and why?
Thanks guys.

item.title: YOUR favorite Borderlands? Help me out people
item.dc:creator: @ItsNateDuh ItsNateDuh
item.description:
@ItsNateDuh wrote:

In my opinion, my favorite had to of been “Borderlands 2” I do have all 3 on the other hand, they are still fun to play. “Advanced Warfare” stole “Borderlands: The Pre-Sequal” style of combat anyone? Now that I think about it it’s kind of odd that “Sledgehammer” made a game where you can double jump after “Borderlands: The Pre-Sequal”.

Read full topic
item.source: YOUR favorite Borderlands? Help me out people

item.title: YOUR favorite Borderlands? Help me out people
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

Similar to how IGN ratings depict the games I enjoy BL2 the most, BL1 second, and the pre-sequal is… meh… This is coming from someone who’s bought every game and DLC along with every achievement. The first two games and their DLCs are absolutely mind blowing if you take your time on the story.

Read full topic

item.title: YOUR favorite Borderlands? Help me out people
item.dc:creator: @stCky stCky
item.description:
@stCky wrote:

I’ve only played BL2, and it was co-op with my GF. We actually ended up glitching the game causing both of our saves to get out of sync and it completely stopped us playing, which was kinda shit. But other than that the game was a lot of fun albeit a giant grind with some bosses thrown in

Read full topic

item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:9, topic:548740”]^ and even if you get Holodome, I’ve heard that it sucks.[/quote]it does, wasn’t much of a real challenge; anyways, just started playing it again and it’s not “boring”, but maybe that’s because i found the story slightly amusing and i needed a break from 2.

I don’t like BL, BL 2 is the best, and the Pre seq is good till you beat the main story line.
[/quote]I have it, hadn’t had the chance to play it. Why do you say that?[/quote]there is no “end game” content (unless you count holodome, but i wouldn’t).

item.title: YOUR favorite Borderlands? Help me out people
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:3, topic:548740”]Borderlands 2 is the best by far. There’s so much to do and the story’s great. I’m not the biggest gamer but I have 300+ hours on BL2, compared to only 70 on The Pre-Sequel.

The Pre-Sequel sucks.

Add me on Steam if you wanna play some BL2: Jabawox[/quote]

Basically this. I tried the pre-sequel, which isn’t so great imo compared to borderlands 2.

The Pre-Sequel sucks.

item.title: YOUR favorite Borderlands? Help me out people
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

BL2 was my favorite; one just failed to really grab my attention and TPS seemed quickly done with a massive lack of content to keep my attention once i finished the main story

BL2 kept (keeps) my attention although i’ve beaten the main story quite a few times thanks to the amount of end game raid bosses from all the dlc and just in general to have fun with

Read full topic
